alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 12:59PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Craig, northern Delaware, southwestern Ottawa and northeastern Mayes Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 1259 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 3 miles west of Welch, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Vinita... Grove... Fairland... Afton... Langley... Welch... Bernice... Ketchum... Bluejacket... Disney... Honey Creek State Park... Cherokee State Park... Bernice State Park... Cleora... Chloeta... Narcissa... Hollow... Disney Little Blue State Park... Zena... Pyramid Corners... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 283 and 302. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
